lead_paragraph: ROTH--Irving, of New York City, June 25, 1917 to June 23, 2016. Survived by his loving wife of 70 years, Shirley, beloved sons Mark (Suzanne), Andy (Kathy), grandchildren Raime (Kate), Joey (Jana), Rebecca (Melina), and William, four great- grandchildren, and many nieces and nephews. Served in WWII as an Army Reconnaissance Photographer. Original tenant with other WWII Vets in Stuyvesant Town/Peter Cooper, where Shirley still resides. Founded Argraph Corporation, international supplier of photographic equipment, out of their StuyTown closet. 60- year member of East End Temple, where his funeral will be held at 11am, Sunday, June 26, 245 E. 17th St, NYC. Donations can be made in his honor to: ajc.org. We love you, Irv. 1/3
